snippet: Mr. Freeman was a stage and screen actor who made his mark in both drama and race relations with roles like Malcolm X and Elijah Muhammad.
abstract: Al Freeman Jr, a star among a generation of black actors that emerged during the civil rights era, and who portrayed some of the movement's most forbidding personalities, dies at age 78.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Freeman was a stage and screen actor who made his mark in both drama and race relations with roles like Malcolm X and Elijah Muhammad.

headline.seo: Al Freeman Jr., Actor Prominent in Civil Rights Era, Dies at 78
headline.main: Al Freeman Jr., Actor Prominent in Civil Rights Era, Dies at 78
headline.print_headline: Al Freeman Jr. Dies at 78; A Performer as Activist
